author: Marcos López de Prado
content: Defines regime detection, combinatorial feature selection, and backtest integrity controls that help algorithmic strategies differentiate signal from overfitting. Key ideas: combinatorial purged k-fold CV, meta-labeling, and structural risk minimization via hierarchical clustering.

author: Lawrence McMillan
content: Compares spreads, calendars, condors, and covered-call structures, summarizing risk/reward, margin impact, and volatility assumptions. Lists how delta, vega, and time decay translate into entry filters and trade management rules.

author: Lowell Miller
content: Ranks stocks by dividend history, payout ratio, valuation and growth, recommending a concentrated dividend-growth portfolio plus a buffer of high-quality REITs. Highlights how to combine cash flow stability with duration control for bonds and Treasuries.

author: Chainalysis Research
content: Documents illicit/outflow volumes, compliance hotspots, and the evolving role of on-chain analytics. Provides context for sentiment signals tied to regulatory scrutiny, AML enforcement, and stablecoin redemption pressure.

author: Internal RAG team
content: Use Sentence-Transformer bi-encoder for dense recall, fallback to BM25 keyword scoring, and rely on the chroma client shim (see src/utils/pydantic_compat.py) before importing BaseSettings. Sync the vector store via python3.11 with TMPDIR set to a workspace tmp/ directory on macOS.

author: src/utils/pydantic_compat.py
content: Ensures Pydantic < 2.0 disables the non-annotated attribute guard before Chroma imports, preventing the chroma_coordinator_host TypeError when chroma uses BaseSettings. Mentioned as an ingestion note so future updates know the patch order.
